column1:
I'm not here for excuses. Go have fun with your
girls. Goodbye.

No, no! You don't understand, I'm on the job
right now!
Do not come near me again, got it?

Can't even look your daughter in the eye?
Of course! You refuse to face up to anything.
The way I see it, you're no father to me.

What do we even do!? We really crashed that
ship...

This whole thing is entirely our fault. We're the
ones who should explain everything.
Um, um! Hang on a second? Please?
Please don't take it out on him.
Wha— YOU guys! What're you doing here!?
I'm the guy from the phone.
Oookay, and... What do you want?

She's totally suspicious of us... I would be too,
but...

Sorry to barge in on this, but please, we have to
tell you something first!

Why did you come here!? I told you, wait until
tomorrow!

Well, we are the ones responsible for upsetting
your daughter.

We're working a case together, so we were all
traveling as a group until he ran off to meet you.

Since your father volunteered to handle the
driving, he answered the phone instead.
So, when I talked to you...

Mmhm, he was driving us all to Kyoto. We're so
sorry we upset you.

In that case, please excuse my awful behavior.
I'm sorry for jumping the gun and making a
scene like that.

Whoa, she's so well-behaved! She's already
more mature than Ryuji.

Shuddup! But for real, you sure don't seem like
you'd be HIS kid.

So, Akane-chan! You and your dad made a
promise about today, right?
We are so sorry he got here late. That's totally our fault, too.

Yeah, I'm sorry too, Akane. I promise, I really
did remember it was today...

It's just, this case is dragging us all over the place,
and, heheh...

Also, you told me none of this. Couldn't you
have simply explained all of this to me
before today?
She's ripping into him at an adult level...

To think she's so cold to her father on such
a day...

Uh, ohhhh...! You know how the police can't
talk about active cases and stuff, right?

That's right. In the force, any information about
a case that leaks to the public could ruin all our
hard work.
C'mon, just cut him some slack.

Sure I don't got a right to talk, considerin' all
the hell I put my own mom through...

But he's taking care of you, right? So don't go
bitin' his head off over this.

Yeah, if I did that to Sojiro? It'd probably take
him the better part of the year to recover.

Um, we're not trying to pile on you, though.
I'm sure you have your own reasons for what
you said.

But his delay really was because of work.
Please, at least don't blame him for that.

We especially regret causing trouble on such
an important day.
May we pay our respects as well?

Don't sweat it—but don't forget you owe us one
too, Zenkichi.

Hey! Zip on the lips, Cat! I am not explaining all
this to Akane!

Don't worry, Akane can't hear a thing. C'mon,
let's go pay our respects.

We offered our prayers
to the deceased...
So, two years... How the time flies.

Oh, why don't we go together? I'll order some
takeout—
No thank you. I want nothing to do with you.

Boy, is she icing Gramps out or what? This isn't
just some "teen rebel" thing.

But she's so polite, too... I really wonder what
could've happened.

Hey, sorry about all that. You guys really did
save me back there.

I've got to get home, but I'll see you all
tomorrow. Be in touch, yeah?

Fine by us, buuut... You sure you're good to
just go home like that?

Ah, don't worry. She's just at that age, you
know?

I know you don't get home too often, but is
everything okay there? Akane-chan's eating
well and all that?

Yeah, my wife's parents are just next door—
she just shuts herself up in her room every
day, is all...

From what they tell me, she always eats in her
room—easy, packaged stuff...

I'm always away at work, so I really don't know
anything about her diet.

She's a growing young lady. I hope she's at
least eating well...
I mean, I send her money, at least.

She's already a third-year in middle school.
I'm pretty sure she's set in her ways.
I want to help her somehow.

Yeah, after what we put her through, I want to
at least do something nice for her today.

Her dad's taken decent care of us so far—why
don't we treat him and the kid to a nice meal?

That's a great idea. I'd like to speak more with
her. We can even help cook!

Sounds like we'll need to stay over tonight.
Let's make sure we pick up plenty of groceries.

Wha— Wait a minute! You can't just invite
yourselves over like that, dammit!

Hey! Hey, you damn kids! Are you seriously
crashing my place!?
Am I just talking to myself heeere!?
